choices.B: Set the Radio Policy option to 802.11g Only.
choices.C: Set the Radio Policy option to 802.11a Only.
choices.D: Set the Interface/Interface Group(G) to an interface other than guest.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A Cisco engineer creates a new WLAN called lantest. Which two actions must be performed so that only high-speed 2.4-Ghz clients connect? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Answers are A (you have to enable the WLAN for it become operational) and B

Selected Answer: AB
A. enable the WLAN
B. 802.1g broadband 2.4-Ghz

Selected Answer: AB
A & B are correct

Selected Answer: AB
A is correct since the status option needs to be checked to enable the wireless LAN
B is correct since 802.11g only allows 2.4Ghz client to connect to the network
C is incorrect since 802.11a will enable 5Ghz clients to connect to the network.
D vlan groups/interfaces is used to associate traffic with a specific vlan in the wired network and it is not relevant to our question.
E is incorrect, the question didn't ask us to broadcast the network

Selected Answer: AB
You don't have to broadcast SSID

Selected Answer: BD
B and D

Selected Answer: BE
Shouldn`t be "BE" cause 802.1g only supports 2.4-Ghz?

comments.content: Enable SSID Broadcast is not one of the two choices. With SSID broadcast disabled, the effect is that clients will need to know the SSID information in order to connect to the WLAN, so basically it "hides" the SSID from clients that don't know about it already. It's not relevant to this question.

You are right, AB is correct.
Status check box is MUST to enable this WLAN

choices.D: It generates one spanning-tree instance for each VLAN.
choices.B: It requires multiple links between core switches.
choices.C: It maps multiple VLANs into the same spanning-tree instance.
choices.A: It uses multiple active paths between end stations.

questions.question_text: How does Rapid PVST+ create a fast loop-free network topology?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
One of Rapid PVST+ features is Per VLAN Spanning Tree: Each VLAN has its own spanning tree instance, allowing for more granular control and better load balancing across the network

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Rapid PVST+ creates a fast loop-free network topology by generating one spanning-tree instance for each VLAN.

Selected Answer: D
Rapid PVST+ (Per VLAN Spanning Tree Plus) is an enhancement to the original IEEE 802.1D spanning tree protocol. It creates a fast loop-free network topology by generating a separate spanning-tree instance for each VLAN.

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D
A is incorrect having multiple active paths between end stations causes loops in the
network.
B I couldn't find how is it related to the question
C is done through MST (Multiple spanning tree) protocol 

https://networklessons.com/spanning-tree/multiple-spanning-tree-mst

Selected Answer: D
Rapid PVST+ creates a fast loop-free network topology by generating one spanning-tree instance for each VLAN, which is option D.

choices.E: preventing collisions between wireless clients on the same RF channel

the answer is correct, WLC handles RF management, Security/ QOS management, client authentication, client association/ roaming management

questions.question_text: Which two functions does a WLC perform in the lightweight access-point architecture that an AP performs independently in an autonomous architecture? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B is correct
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
TCP - connection-oriented
UDP - connectionless

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
UDP speeds up transmissions by enabling the transfer of data before an agreement is provided by the receiving party. As a result, UDP is beneficial in time- sensitive communications, including voice over IP (VoIP), domain name system (DNS) lookup, and video or audio playback.

choices.B: TCP requires the connection to be established before transmitting data. UDP transmits data at a higher rate without ensuring packet delivery.
choices.C: UDP sets up a connection between both devices before transmitting data. TCP uses the three-way handshake to transmit data with a reliable connection.
choices.D: UDP is used for multicast and broadcast communication. TCP is used for unicast communication and transmits data at a higher rate with error checking.
choices.A: TCP transmits data at a higher rate and ensures packet delivery. UDP retransmits lost data to ensure applications receive the data on the remote end.

questions.question_text: What is the difference in data transmission delivery and reliability between TCP and UDP?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Navigate to WLAN > Edit > Security > Layer2, and select None for Layer 2 Security:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless-mobility/wireless-lan-wlan/116879-configure-wlc-00.html

Out of the three options (A. Set the Layer 2 Security to None, B. Disable Web Passthrough, and C. Enable the WPA Policy), enabling the WPA Policy (option C) is the most suitable approach to complete the configuration of a wireless LAN (WLAN) with Web Passthrough Layer 3 Web Policy.

Here's why:

WPA Policy: Enabling WPA (Wi-Fi Protected Access) policy provides Layer 2 security for the WLAN. This means data transmissions between devices and the access point are encrypted, protecting them from eavesdropping and unauthorized access.
Compatibility with Web Passthrough: WPA (specifically WPA2-PSK with AES encryption) is compatible with Web Passthrough functionality. Users can still connect initially without full authentication, but WPA secures the data transmission after the initial connection.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct - No L2 security for web pass thru

Selected Answer: D
I think its D

Selected Answer: D
"D" should be correct answer

choices.B: Enable TKIP and CCMP256 WPA2 Encryption.
choices.D: Set the Layer 2 Security to None.
